result.execSummary:
The defendant Clinton J Schumacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and continue with apprenticeship. May not possess any firearms during the term of probation. All weapons must be in the father's locked safe and the defendant is to have NO access to the combination. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

charges.descr: Possess Firearm on Grounds of a School

Defendant Clinton J Schumacher in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Sharon A. Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Prior to calling case. The Court indicates that he represented this deft's sister and he knows his parents and occasionally sees deft's father on the tennis court. Neither party wishes the Court to recuse himself.
Upon plea to Cts 1 & 3. Ct 2 is DRI. The State recommends 18 mos RCJ on each, 2 mos RCJ on Ct 1, AODA/ua's and other reasonable conditions.
P-G to both
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

The State is specifically asking that the firearm used in this incident be destroyed.

Defense asks that deft be given a fine on Ct 3 and in Ct 1, defense asks for probation but for any conditional jail time to be stayed. Defense asks the Court to hold its decision regarding firearm in abeyance. Ms. Moore will be filing a motion and indicates the firearm actually belongs to his father.

BTC: guilty as above. Sent w/held - 18 mos probation on each count. The court will not destroy the weapon and accepts the representation of deft's father that the weapon is his. Defense to prepare the order to return the weapon.

Defendant Clinton J Schumacher in court with attorney Erika L Moore.  Sharon A Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 08:15 am.
ZCI
Preliminary hearing on June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Clinton J Schumacher in court with attorney Erika L Moore.  Alexei E Gasiorkiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
